metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2225 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
inc/ticket.class.php in GLPI 0.83.9 and earlier allows remote attackers tounserialize arbitrary PHP objects via the _predefined_fields parameter tofront/ticket.form.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glpi - 0.84.3+dfsg.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glpi package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.84.3+dfsg.1-1').
